intro: Henckelia longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
